entry.title: How to ‘dad’ - a comprehensive guide for dummies.
entry.summary:
Author: Solar_ashh

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,208Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 72

Summary: Unfortunately for Bruce even the ‘dummies guide’ was too far advanced for the bimbo billionaire, and too emotionally demanding for a certain dark knight.--Bruce is trying his best to be a dad, a CEO, AND a hero; all without the world learning that Bruce Wayne and batman are one in the same, juggle his feelings, and try to keep his new son as happy as possible.---ik it says 'graphic' in the warnings but the warning is more there just bc there's a tad of violence

entry.title: With All Due Respect
entry.summary:
Author: BlueGrapefruitSoda

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,846Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 13

Summary: Bruce gave a slight smile, his voice low and curiosity piqued. “You have permission to speak.” Clark shifted uncomfortably, his gaze dropping to the ground. “As someone who’s dedicated his life to your safety and happiness,” he began, his voice quiet but steady, “it matters deeply to me that you choose a partner truly worthy of you — someone who honors your love and your loyalty.” He drew in a slow breath, then lifted his eyes to meet Bruce’s. “And I’m afraid, my prince… the man you’re considering is not that person.”Or Clark is in love with Bruce, the prince he protects and Bruce is oblivious.

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 5,815Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 33

My kids.”OrThe fic where Clark is asked to babysit the bat kids and it goes about as well as you think it would go. There's also a little bit of superbat at the end, as a treat.

entry.title: Miss Noir’s Society Gossip Blog
entry.summary:
Author: taropot

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,493Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 17

Summary: Gotham’s elite have returned from their summer estates and rehab retreats for another season of charity galas, power marriages, and scandalous whispers. At the centre of it all? An anonymous online gossip columnist known only as Miss Noir — ruthless, relentless, and impeccably well-informed. No one is safe from their barbed prose. Not even Gotham's favourite frivolous playboy, Bruce Wayne. And certainly not the Batman. Tea will spill. Ships will sail. Secrets will out. And Miss Noir? They’ll be watching it all unfold, martini in hand.A Bridgerton-inspired AU set in modern-day Gotham society. Satirical, slowburn, and featuring Superbat plus enough side ships to sink a yacht.

entry.title: The Weight of Expectations
entry.summary:
Author: mustangisinflames

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,920Chapters: 1/2Kudos: 10

Summary: The hologram of his biological father had initially made him overjoyed. To be able to see one of the parents who'd created him, to talk to him, to, at last, ask questions and have them answered - it had been everything he'd ever wanted since ma and pa had told him how they'd found him as a baby. It should've been a slotting into place, a joining of parts; a filling in of that terrible, aching gap in his chest he'd felt ever since the day his powers started appearing and he knew he was irrevocably different. This secluded haven, this part of Krypton tucked safely away in sheets of ice, snow, and permafrost, should've been a comfort.Instead, it was a burden. Clark struggles with an identity he feels he isn't worthy of.Bruce knows exactly who he must be.

entry.title: Lawrusso (and more) one-shots!
entry.summary:
Author: jessiwritesstories

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 102,825Chapters: 52/?Kudos: 110

Summary: Lawrusso one-shots have completely taken over my waking hours. So I'm going to make a whole book about them. These bite-sized stories are packed with everything from heartwarming fluff to gut-wrenching angst, with a hefty dose of spice—not the kind you're thinking, but the kind that brings the drama, action, and intensity that keeps you hooked. Each one is a whirlwind of emotions that I can’t stop devouring. Have fun reading!*Posting whenever I can!*

entry.title: Wholly Human
entry.summary:
Author: unpeumacabre

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 44,778Chapters: 10/10Kudos: 221

Summary: Strange, eldritch things are afoot in Gotham City. It looks like a job for Superman...?Clark Kent, writer from up-and-coming Metropolitan periodical The Daily Planet, is sent to investigate the appearance of a mysterious winged demon - known as the Bat-Man - a creature responsible for terrorising the local constabulary and wreaking general havoc among the good people of Gotham City. However, Clark has a secret - he's also Metropolis' celebrated hero, Superman. And as Superman, he's determined not just to report on, but to stop the Bat-Man from carrying out its fiendish deeds.Instead, he finds more than he bargained for: a web of intrigue surrounding the Viscount of Gotham, Bruce Wayne; his father, who disappeared in a mysterious explosion in Wayne Manor thirty years ago; and Jack Napier, the slightly unhinged Commissioner of the Gotham police force. Unravelling the secrets of Gotham City may turn out to be far too Herculean a task for Superman to undertake, after all...AKA the Victorian Beauty and the Beast AU that got a bit out of hand. Writing is complete - chapters are being slowly released.

entry.title: Thawing Out
entry.summary:
Author: mustangisinflames

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,353Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 59

Summary: “The Batman?”Clark's cheeks were warm but he pushed forward regardless, “What, um, what do you make of him? He's been working in Gotham for about a year now, right?”“I wouldn't know. I've never met him,” Bruce shrugged, “And I don't think I'd like to.”“How come?”“He's violent. I can't say he hasn't been of some benefit - anyone can see that he’s exposed quite a lot of Gotham's underbelly, pointed out the flaws. But running around in a bat costume can hardly be regarded as the actions of a sane and well-adjusted man,” He said, a faint tug at one corner of his lips, a huff of derision in his tone, “Wouldn’t you agree?” Clark and Bruce have lunch. Their not-quite-a-friendship seems to bloom.(continues directly from part 10)

entry.title: weak and powerless (over you)
entry.summary:
Author: byzantinedaydeams

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 7,923Chapters: 2/16Kudos: 66

Summary: Batman doesn’t trust Superman as far as he can throw him. As it turns out, with a little (a lot) of Kryptonite, that’s not very far. While Batman doesn’t normally compromise his rules, Bruce Wayne deals in gray areas. Compartmentalizing has its perks, and they taste like strawberry lip balm. Although it might seem like their common lifestyles as vigilantes make them a perfect match, as they get to know each other better, they each realize that there is more to the other than meets the eye.(Or: Clark gets a metric fuck-ton of Kryptonite stuck in his body and Bruce decides he’s allowed to break his unwritten “don’t kiss Clark” rule)

entry.title: The Doorway
entry.summary:
Author: GothamiteEditor

Rating: Not RatedLanguage: EnglishWords: 14,932Chapters: 7/?Kudos: 1,255

Summary: Peter should really learn not to let his curiosity or desire to prove he's worthy to be Spider-Man make decisions for him.Or.Peter Parker ends up in the Watch Tower, humiliates himself in front of a dude named Superman (no hyphen) and then is stranded with no way home. All because he couldn't not touch a magic door.Captain Marvel doesn't want the world to explode because someone touched a magical door.Superman just wanted to have non-ruined shoes.Batman is trying very hard not to adopt a child he can't keep.Formerly known as “Why You Shouldn’t Mess with Magic Doors”
